page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY 03800597
page.content: Settlement dates back to Prehistory with{Iron Age/Romano_British}farms and field systems at Birdhope,Woolaw and Netherhouses.The{Romans}established an outpost fort at Bremenium,temporary camps at Birdhopecraig, Sills and Silloans;a cemetery at Petty Knowes,a main road north, Dere Street,and a branch road running east.In{Mediaeval} times a village grew up inside the fort walls;2 bastles (defensible farm houses) were built here in the{16th } {century}when many local farms were frequently raided by{Border Reivers. In the 1680s Birdhopecraig {Presbyterian Chapel}was founded by covenanting ministers.Rural industries began to develop in the{18th century} :cornmills,'collieries and limekilns. By{1840 a turnpike (A68)}replaced Dere Street; Rochester village and school built by{Lord Redesdale}for tenants.
